topics.title: Introduction and background on growth misinformation
topics.summary: Elena frames growth as a young discipline with lots of out-of-context “growth hacks,” leading to repeated failures and high churn in growth leadership roles.

topics.title: Tactic #1: Hiring growth too early
topics.summary: Elena argues founders must lead early growth until there’s real product-market fit and enough data volume for experimentation; otherwise a growth hire is premature and set up to fail.

topics.title: Sales-led vs product-led timing for growth hires
topics.summary: They discuss when to hire sales vs growth depending on whether monetization is sales-led or self-serve/product-led, and how growth becomes more relevant as product takes on funnel responsibilities.

topics.title: Tactic #2: Hiring growth to reverse decline
topics.summary: Elena warns that bringing in a head of growth to fix a slowing/declining business rarely works; growth can optimize but can’t solve deeper product or GTM issues causing the slowdown.

topics.title: Tactic #3: Rebrands and homepage redesigns for growth
topics.summary: Elena says marketing-site redesigns/rebrands almost always hurt performance initially and rarely drive acquisition; if you do them, plan for a dip and months of post-launch optimization.

topics.title: Tactic #4: Copying competitors and misusing benchmarks
topics.summary: Competitive research is useful for inspiration and pattern-spotting, but copying flows blindly fails because contexts differ; benchmarks are also risky due to inconsistent metric definitions.

topics.title: Tactic #5: Treating problems as unique (starting from scratch)
topics.summary: Elena argues most growth problems are common and should be solved by learning from others, reusing patterns/frameworks, and asking experts—rather than reinventing solutions with high opportunity cost.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: OneSchema ad read and short discussion about CSV imports and integration reliability.

topics.title: Recap of tactics one through five
topics.summary: Lenny summarizes the first five “tactics that never work,” reinforcing the key takeaways around hiring timing, decline dynamics, redesign pitfalls, competitor copying, and not reinventing the wheel.

topics.title: Tactic #6: Growth teams over-prioritizing SEO/SEM
topics.summary: Elena argues growth teams should prioritize building owned/earned acquisition channels (virality, word-of-mouth, UGC) over relying on algorithm-driven platforms where costs rise and control is limited.
